search.slidetext: understanding the dassault systèmes code of business conduct master the key rules to work in an ethical and responsible environment proceed to the course

animation play, pause, or replay animation on the current screen using these buttons. menu: click the menu to navigate through the course screens. click a screen name to access that screen. progress bar the progress bar indicates the progress of current screen/animation. notes/script access the transcript of the audio using this button. navigation tips bookmarking at any point, you can pause the course and it will bookmark your current position in the course. it allows you to come back at a later time and resume from where you left off earlier. the timeline indicates your current position in the course and displays completed/remaining portions of the course. timeline

audience and pre-requisites introduction audience this course is meant for all dassault systèmes employees. pre-requisites this course requires you to have read the 3ds code of business conduct as a prerequisite. you will find the code at the following link: code of business conduct
dassault systèmes code of business conduct understanding the master the key rules to work in an ethical and responsible manner introduction

learning objectives dassault systèmes’ commitments the company’s commitments related to social and environmental engagement, ethical business conduct, and protection of assets & confidential information; the company’s commitments related to social and environmental engagement, ethical business conduct, and protection of assets & confidential information; expected employee behavior the behaviors expected from you; where to seek advice how and where to seek advice if you are facing a difficult situation or an ethical dilemma; and how to report violations how to speak up if you witness an ethics breach or a violation of a code of business conduct provision. at the end of this course you will be able to understand: introduction
introduction

introduction message from the vice chairman and ceo bernard charlès vice chairman of the board and chief executive officer compliance with ethical rules and international standards is an integral part of the purpose of dassault systèmes, to “imagine sustainable innovations capable of harmonizing product, nature and life”. there is no harmony, nor sustainability without good ethics. these ethical principles must guide our corporate conduct and are key to our role and reputation as a strategic partner to our customers. integrity is non-negotiable
click to continue. chapter 1: social and environmental engagement
social and environmental engagement mutual respect diversity and inclusion respect for the environment social and environmental engagement

mutual respect colleagues customers partners and diversity within our ecosystem work environment discrimination harassment intimidation social and environmental engagement - mutual respect, diversity, and inclusion
social and environmental engagement - definitions: discrimination and sexual harassment dassault systèmes does not tolerate discrimination sexual harassment

social and environmental engagement - definitions: discrimination and sexual harassment discrimination different and negative treatment due to: age handicap gender marital status/pregnancy ethnic/national/social origin religion sexual orientation union membership opinion political affiliation

social and environmental engagement - definitions: discrimination and sexual harassment sexual harassment unwelcome behavior physical/verbal/non-verbal sexual overtones compromise a person’s dignity intimidating hostile degrading humiliating offensive

continue continue continue continue continue continue lisa i receive comments from a colleague about my outfit or my physical appearance. this situation makes me feel uncomfortable. i would like to report this situation but i don’t want to overreact and i’m afraid it could affect my career at 3ds. what should i do? social and environmental engagement - mutual respect, diversity, and inclusion—scenario talk to your colleague expressing your concerns. if he continues, report the matter to human resources or write to people.ethicscommittee@3ds.com. talk to your colleague expressing your concerns. if he continues, report the matter to human resources or write to people.ethicscommittee@3ds.com. talk to your colleague expressing your concerns. if he continues, report the matter to human resources or write to people.ethicscommittee@3ds.com. talk to your colleague expressing your concerns. if he continues, report the matter to human resources or write to people.ethicscommittee@3ds.com. keep quiet, or you could lose your job. keep quiet, or you could lose your job. keep quiet, or you could lose your job. keep quiet, or you could lose your job. avoid being in the same room as my colleague, even if this reduces my job efficiency. avoid being in the same room as my colleague, even if this reduces my job efficiency. avoid being in the same room as my colleague, even if this reduces my job efficiency. avoid being in the same room as my colleague, even if this reduces my job efficiency. submit submit submit submit matt

social and environmental engagement - mutual respect, diversity, and inclusion—scenario uncomfortable about a situation? contact your hr people and organization partner - pop. write to people.ethicscommittee@3ds.com emily ethics & compliance officer
click to continue. chapter 2: ethical business conduct
ethical business conduct engaging with third parties insider trading financial reports compliance with competition law export controls personal data protection ethical business conduct

remain vigilant what is corruption? corruption means a situation in which something of value is promised, given or allowed to be given improperly, directly or indirectly to someone, with the aim of obtaining an undue advantage by inciting this person to perform or not to perform an action as part of their duties. offering a person an undue advantage with the aim of obtaining special treatment, a job, contract or any other undue advantage from an authority or body, through the influence of that person is influence-peddling. this is also considered as corruption. continue continue continue continue continue continue continue continue employees must: comply with applicable laws and regulations comply with the company’s anti-bribery policy ethical business conduct - corruption dassault systèmes has a zero-tolerance policy towards corruption and influence peddling.

ethical business conduct - due diligence suppliers partners distributors agents consultants due diligence dassault systèmes must comply with obligations under anti-corruption legislation of most countries perform prior verifications on third parties involved prior verifications: manage risks detect and mitigate negative information and risks

example in 2019 microsoft was held responsible by u.s. authorities for the corrupt behavior of certain of its distributors and agents in various countries and had to pay more than us$ 25 million in fines and penalties. under the anti-corruption laws of many countries, an organization may be held liable for making a payment to a third party while knowing that all or a portion of the payment will go directly or indirectly to a foreign official or other decision-maker. the term “knowing” includes deliberate ignorance or willful blindness. under the anti-corruption laws of many countries, an organization may be held liable for making a payment to a third party while knowing that all or a portion of the payment will go directly or indirectly to a foreign official or other decision-maker. the term “knowing” includes deliberate ignorance or willful blindness. did you know? can dassault systèmes be held liable for acts of corruption committed by third parties such as an agent or a distributor? ethical business conduct - due diligence yes yes yes yes submit submit submit submit jason ethics & compliance officer no no no no select the correct option.

anticorruption policy ethical business conduct - gifts and invitations gifts and invitation gift /hospitality procedure anticorruption video refer to the 3ds: refer to the 3ds anti-corruption policy, regarding the rules applicable when offering/giving gifts and invitations and sets specific amounts that cannot be exceeded without prior authorization (available on the 3dexperience platform 3dsone - oneconduct)

continue continue continue continue continue continue ethical business conduct - gifts and invitations scenario mike for christmas i have received a gourmet gift basket from a business partner. the total value of the basket is about us$120. yes yes yes yes submit submit submit submit no no no no can i accept it?

ethical business conduct - gifts and invitations scenario do not accept or offer gifts that are: lavish inappropriate illegal embarrassing do not accept or offer gifts or invitations that: intend to influence create conflict of interest jason ethics & compliance officer yes, you can, but, because the gift exceeds the cap of us$ 100 mentioned in the anti-corruption policy, you have the obligation to declare this gift and seek approval from your manager and your local finance department. ideally, you should share the contents of the basket with your team.
ethical business conduct - donations, sponsorship, patronage and political contributions

ethical business conduct - conflicts of interest conflicts of interest situation in which someone cannot make a fair decision employees are expected to behave in an exemplary manner and to act in the best interest of dassault systèmes, avoiding situations of real or apparent conflict of interest.

ethical business conduct - conflicts of interest examples continue continue continue continue continue continue continue continue continue continue continue continue continue continue continue continue

ethical business conduct - conflicts of interest scenario potential conflicts of interest but what should i do if i think i could be in such a situation? please seek advice from: your management jason ethics & compliance officer dassault systèmes employee hr ethics and compliance [people.ethicscommittee@3ds.com] jason ethics & compliance officer dassault systèmes employee legal

ethical business conduct - insider information insider information relating directly or indirectly to dassault systèmes or its securities confidential specific material likely to have a significant effect on the company’s share price information could be used by investor for an investment decision

ethical business conduct - insider information dassault systèmes complies with legislation with respect to insider trading. dassault systèmes complies with legislation with respect to insider trading. to avoid insider trading, employees must not: purchase or sell the shares of dassault systèmes or of a customer, partner company or any other listed company when they have insider information on this company disclose insider information
ethical business conduct - financial reports

dassault systèmes suppliers customers distributors competition rules consequently employees must ensure they: do not discuss certain subjects, such as prices and the issues involved in setting prices. refuse to enter into agreements with competitors concerning prices, customers and sales territories. defend the company’s interests as best they can and treat distributors fairly. consequently employees must ensure they: do not discuss certain subjects, such as prices and the issues involved in setting prices. refuse to enter into agreements with competitors concerning prices, customers and sales territories. defend the company’s interests as best they can and treat distributors fairly. ethical business conduct - compliance with competition law

ethical business conduct - compliance with competition law : scenario william legal counsel daniel 3ds employee a distributor is heavily discounting its prices for a dassault systèmes product. can i ask him to sell at list price? continue continue continue continue no. distributors are independent companies. they are free to set their own end-user prices and discounts without direction or influence from dassault systèmes. continue continue continue continue extra discount: distributors may request an extra discount beyond their pre-agreed discount rate to win an opportunity. if dassault systèmes approves the request, then the distributor is required to pass on the extra discount to the end customer. in such case, distributor remains free to grant additional discount(s) to the end customer.

select continue to proceed. continue continue continue not only is dassault systèmes obliged to ensure its software license sales comply with these regulations, but we must also ensure that the customer data provided to us through our support and services activities is protected according to the same rules. note: for additional information, please contact the export compliance team at: 3ds.compliance-export@3ds.com select continue to proceed. continue continue continue not only is dassault systèmes obliged to ensure its software license sales comply with these regulations, but we must also ensure that the customer data provided to us through our support and services activities is protected according to the same rules. note: for additional information, please contact the export compliance team at: 3ds.compliance-export@3ds.com ethical business conduct - trade and export compliance ethical business conduct - trade and export compliance trade and export compliance trade export rigorous procedures to ensure dassault systèmes conducts business grants licenses in compliance with applicable rules did you know? do export control regulations and sanction programs apply to areas other than sales at dassault systèmes? yes yes yes yes submit submit submit submit violet export compliance specialist no no no no select the correct option.
ethical business conduct - personal data
ethical business conduct - personal data scenario
click to continue. chapter 3: protection of assets and confidential information
protection of assets and confidential information use of digital media protection of assets and confidential information
protection of assets and confidential information - intellectual property assets and confidential information intellectual property confidential information

protection of intellectual property assets and confidential information - intellectual property intellectual property intellectual property is a major asset of dassault systèmes protected by intellectual property rights copyright patents trademarks related rights software inventions brands know-how

protection of intellectual property assets and confidential information - confidential information confidential information use is restricted or prohibited belonging to dassault systèmes or to third-parties disclosed only to authorized recipients information:

protection of assets and confidential information - assets and confidential information: scenario 1 continue continue continue continue scenario 1 sometimes it is easier for me to email confidential documents using my private email account so that i can work from home. is that allowed? claire intellectual property counsel no, it is not allowed. we must be extremely careful to protect dassault systèmes’ or customer’s confidential information. sending documents using an unsecured messaging account can lead to the inadvertent disclosure of confidential information. please refer to the 3ds confidentiality policy and it security rules both available on the 3dexperience platform 3dsone - oneconduct no, it is not allowed. we must be extremely careful to protect dassault systèmes’ or customer’s confidential information. sending documents using an unsecured messaging account can lead to the inadvertent disclosure of confidential information. please refer to the 3ds confidentiality policy and it security rules both available on the 3dexperience platform 3dsone - oneconduct contact: information.security@3ds.com or 3ds.legal-ip@3ds.com contact: information.security@3ds.com or 3ds.legal-ip@3ds.com continue continue continue continue continue continue continue continue scenario 2 i just received an email from a customer that was not intended for me. the email included customer confidential information regarding a bid on an upcoming contract. i think that i must delete the email, but i am not sure if there is anything else i should do? is there anything else i should do? claire intellectual property counsel you should immediately inform your manager and seek guidance from the ethics & compliance or legal department. since you were not the intended recipient, and even though you deleted the information, it may still put the company at risk. employees should not use information that was obtained illegally or improperly. protection of assets and confidential information - assets and confidential information: scenario 2
protection of assets and confidential information - use of digital media media electronic digital tools occasional personal use may be tolerated avoid abuse
click to continue. chapter 4: whistleblowing

do not: report without specifics make false report with malicious intent dassault systèmes rules: we protect whistleblower and ensure confidentiality we prohibit retaliation in any form your manager, or ethics and compliance department: people.ethicscommittee@3ds.com provide a brief description by e-mail or telephone or by dassault systèmes internal messaging better to identify yourself to facilitate the investigation what to report? what to report? what to report? what to report? who to report to? who to report to? who to report to? who to report to? corruption or business or ethical misconduct criminal offense serious infringement to human rights or fundamental freedoms, to health and safety or to the environment by extension: any breach of the dassault systèmes code of business conduct how to report? how to report? how to report? how to report? who to report to? who to report to? who to report to? who to report to? whistleblowing whistleblowing what to report? what to report? what to report? what to report? what to report? how to report? how to report? how to report? how to report? how to report? who to report to? who to report to? who to report to? who to report to? who to report to? select each tab to explore. emily ethics & compliance officer jason ethics & compliance officer continue continue continue

conclusion how to make the right decision? understand and comply with the code and the law wherever you are. use good judgment and avoid even the appearance of improper behavior. emily ethics & compliance officer

resources 3dsone-oneconduct is the 3ds dashboard dedicated to ethics, compliance and security topics. anti-corruption policy competition law compliance policy confidentiality policy export control policy insider rules conflicts of interest guidelines it charter data protection guidelines whistleblowing procedure the following company policies related to the code of business conduct can be found there: you will find the code at the following link: code of business conduct

continue continue continue continue continue continue continue continue continue continue click the x button of the browser to close the course. course completion congratulations! you have completed the course dassault systèmes code of business conduct. i hereby acknowledge and declare that i have read the dassault systèmescode of business conduct and agree to comply with its terms.
